abstract: NBA players reject offer to split league revenue with owners because it represents a 7 percent, or $280 million, reduction from the current level; no further meetings are scheduled and the start of the season is in jeopardy.
snippet: No further meetings are scheduled this week in the labor dispute that is threatening the 2011-12 N.B.A. season.
lead_paragraph: No further meetings are scheduled this week in the labor dispute that is threatening the 2011-12 N.B.A. season.

headline.main: N.B.A. Players Rejecting a 50-50 Split of Revenue
headline.print_headline: N.B.A. Players Rejecting a 50-50 Split of Revenue
headline.seo: N.B.A. Labor Talks: Players Rejected a 50-50 Split of Revenue
